name: Min Hwan Oh
content: Min-hwan Oh | Seoul National University Min-hwan Oh is an Associate Professor in the Graduate School of Data Science at Seoul National University. His primary research interests are in sequential decision making, reinforcement learning, bandit algorithms, optimization, statistical machine learning, and their various applications. â†’ Recent News Sep 2025 9 papers accepted at NeurIPS 2025 (including 1 Spotlight) in the main track, and 1 paper accepted in the position track June 2025 Received the Amazon Research Award May 2025 5 papers accepted at ICML 2025, and 1 paper at COLT 2025 Jan 2025 5 papers accepted at ICLR 2025 Sep 2024 5 papers accepted at NeurIPS 2024 Aug 2024 Our paper won an Outstanding Paper Award at 2024 Korea Artificial Intelligence Association. May 2024 1 paper accepted at COLT 2024 Jan 2024 1 paper accepted at ICLR 2024 Dec 2023 3 papers accepted at AAAI 2024 Sep 2023 1 paper accepted at NeurIPS 2023 Jul 2023 Our papers won a Best Paper Award and an Outstanding Paper Award at 2023 Korea Artificial Intelligence Association. Apr 2023 3 papers accepted at ICML 2023 Jan 2023 1 paper accepted at AISTATS 2023 Nov 2022 1 paper accepted at AAAI 2023 Aug 2022 Our paper won an Outstanding Paper Award at 2022 Korea Artificial Intelligence Association. Mar 2022 1 paper accepted at WWW 2022 Sep 2021 Min-hwan has been selected as a Creative-Pioneering Researcher at SNU. May 2021 1 paper accepted at ICML 2021 Jan 2021 1 paper accepted at AAAI 2021 Nov 2020 Min-hwan's Ph.D. thesis received a finalist recognition for George B. Dantzig Dissertation Award. See more
